messages.content: Pull out the notes in this perfume and make a table to show a set of different types of perfume with a similar profile and the notes they need as a top/base/mid

Sure! Here's a table showing different types of perfumes with a similar profile and the notes they require as top, base, and mid:

| Perfume Type | Top Notes | Base Notes | Mid Notes |
|--------------|-----------|------------|-----------|
| Citrus       | Lemon, Lime, Bergamot | Oakmoss, Musk | Mandarin, Neroli, Grapefruit |
| Floral       | Rose, Jasmine, Lily of the Valley | Vanilla, Patchouli | Peony, Freesia, Gardenia |
| Oriental     | Bergamot, Cardamom, Cinnamon | Amber, Sandalwood | Vanilla, Tonka Bean, Patchouli |
| Woody        | Bergamot, Cedarwood, Vetiver | Patchouli, Amber | Sandalwood, Oakmoss, Musk |
| Fruity       | Apple, Pear, Peach | Coconut, Musk | Raspberry, Blackcurrant, Plum |

Please note that this is just a sample table, and there are many more perfume types and variations. The notes listed here are commonly associated with each type, but there can be variations and combinations depending on the specific perfume formulation.
can you update the table by adding petrichor / geosmine to it

Certainly! Here's an updated table with the addition of petrichor/geosmine note:

| Perfume Type | Top Notes | Base Notes | Mid Notes | Additional Notes |
|--------------|-----------|------------|-----------|-----------------|
| Citrus       | Lemon, Lime, Bergamot | Oakmoss, Musk | Mandarin, Neroli, Grapefruit | Petrichor/Geosmine |
| Floral       | Rose, Jasmine, Lily of the Valley | Vanilla, Patchouli | Peony, Freesia, Gardenia | Petrichor/Geosmine |
| Oriental     | Bergamot, Cardamom, Cinnamon | Amber, Sandalwood | Vanilla, Tonka Bean, Patchouli | Petrichor/Geosmine |
| Woody        | Bergamot, Cedarwood, Vetiver | Patchouli, Amber | Sandalwood, Oakmoss, Musk | Petrichor/Geosmine |
| Fruity       | Apple, Pear, Peach | Coconut, Musk | Raspberry, Blackcurrant, Plum | Petrichor/Geosmine |

I've added the "Additional Notes" column to include petrichor/geosmine as a note for each perfume type. Petrichor is the earthy scent produced when rain falls on dry soil, while geosmine is a compound responsible for the earthy aroma of beets and other natural sources. These notes can add a unique and natural element to perfumes.
